alert.note: Alert for Western Pendleton (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 03 at 7:11PM EST until February 04 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of western Virginia and eastern West Virginia, including the following areas: in western Virginia, Western Highland. In eastern West Virginia, Western Pendleton. * WHEN...Through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Moderate rainfall is expected to continue through tonight with rainfall amounts around 1.5 inches most likely. The combination of the rainfall along with melting snow may cause creeks and streams to rise out of their banks as well as potential flooding in poor drainage areas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
